document_data.name: Leepak Brislen
document_data.mainbody:
'''Leepak Brislen''' was the wife to [[Dharin Brislen]] and mother to [[Blossom Brislen|Blossom]] and [[Bunny Brislen]], all inhabitants of the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|I hate this! That lousy smuggler won't take all of us because we can't afford four berths. Greedy bastard!|Leepak Brislen}}
document_data.Description: Leepak was a [[human]] woman with a tan skin tone, hazel eyes, and long, bright chestnut hair. She wore a simple workman's garb.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, as the [[Cult of the Absolute]] menaced the city of Baldur's Gate, Dharin Brislen attempted to ship Leepak and their daughters away from the Gate. He attempted to negotiate a passage to [[Waterdeep]] with Captain [[Sleam]], a smuggler with her own boat and crew. Sleam asked for too much money, claiming it was a life-and-death situation for her crew too. Dharin could not afford to pay for four seats, so he resorted to staying behind. It was unknown if Leepak and the girls escaped the Gate before the battle of the [[Upper City]] commenced.
